poem:
**Borderlines**

In the gap between lands and lies,  
whispers weave with desert winds—  
troublesome tales of shadows,  
ghosts conjured in diplomatic mist.  
Sheinbaum stands beneath the sun,  
an eclipse of speculation;  
there are no footprints in the sand,  
no whispers to untangle,  
only the dry echo  
of politics and shadows.
